channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @film_girl @gruber @kevinhoctor Actually there's a way to avoid that mess. Take an extra step to eliminate vowels before trying to solve it.

If Twitter had peered with other Twitter-like systems then they never would have had to develop and pay for content moderation. It's *possible* this is factored into Musk's plan. File this under "silos are expensive to run."
When I was a kid my parents said "If you're so smart why aren't you rich?"
It wasn't a nice thing to say, but there's some truth to it, the other way around.
Musk is a smart guy. If you've come to the conclusion he's stupid, that's probably wrong.
A fungible token that people actually want. https://t.co/gksn6S67RZ
Putin and the Russian Orthodox Patriarch see the West as weak and Russia as strong. So they invaded. https://t.co/rUsCWmasmq
@ByteForByte Google Fi
@itsjustmath @aryansawhney17 @phonetonote Iâ€™ve been looking forward to it. ðŸ˜€
@elroyjetson But it only communicates with other WeChat users, right? If so, that doesn't work for me. I added another tweet in the thread that explained.
@elroyjetson why do you hate to say it?
I wonder if we can get @elonmusk @jack and others to agree with this simple statement. My product is interop. https://t.co/yYkHcrwgNf
@nakedjen Jen this one has to be deliberate. It's like they got together and agreed, we won't make our network run on your phones if you agree not to make your network run on our phones.

I need a messaging app that runs on both Android and iOS and has a web interface so I can access it from my Mac and my Chromebook. There must be something out there that fits this bill?
To be clear, it has to a "normal" messaging app that communicates with people who send messages from Android or iOS, using their standard vendor-supplied messaging apps.

Twitter doesn't have to boil the ocean to get out of the way. All they have to do is -- 1. Commit to the Twitter API, and possibly some simple improvements to make it easier for developers.
2. Work with devs to define document type that allows titles, styling, links, enclosures, so Twitter can peer with other networks that develop alongside it.
I'd be happy to work with them on this, or I could just play Nintendo Switch Sports (coming next week!) and do my Wordle every morning, and write my blog and be perfectly happy. ðŸ˜€
However -- like @elonmusk I think Twitter is a vital resource. A long time ago I compared it to a coral reef, and I still stand by that analogy.
https://t.co/bGAZI1sXCB

And then there are all the canceled people who are not famous enough for you to have heard of. https://t.co/vRfQoM7UYW
@film_girl Only 3?
@AMWClarkLaw I almost put her on the list, but I couldn't imagine she'd do it.
@Jason Guy Kawasaki
As long as billionaires buying twitter is in the air, who would you like to see counter Musk's offer?
@NatalieReporter That was a Law & Order episode.
Elon Musk gives Twitter reasons to reject his bid. https://t.co/saHhl3VF4W

Get ready for some obscene opining on MSNBC tonight. They like their TWTR and didn't think it could be bought. These people think of themselves as journalists. Oy.
I'll be watching Season 5 of Better Call Saul.

Private equity giant Thoma Bravo is working on a possible bid for Twitter, a source close to the situation told The Post â€” setting up what could be a rival to Elon Muskâ€™s offer for the social giant. https://t.co/xITKmIOgZb percent20buttons&utm_campaign=site percent20buttons
When I switched from a Pixel 4a to an iPhone 13, I didn't realize that Google's messages app didn't work on iOS, which is causing me all kinds of problems. This stuff doesn't work, basically.
@chrislhayes Many think this is the first sign of maturity -- https://t.co/gGpO5M6jVg Also this -- https://t.co/UogAZlzdQP
